name: Universität Wien
bossPosition: Vice-Rector for Research and International Affairs
goal: The University of Vienna was founded in 1365. It is the oldest university in the German-speaking world and one of the largest in Central Europe. It is associated with 15 Nobel prize winners and has been the academic home to a large number of figures of both historical and academic importance. Currently, about 92,000 students are enrolled at the University of Vienna. They can select from 178 degree programmes, comprising 57 bachelor's programmes, 2 diploma programmes and 119 master's, PhD and doctoral programmes. With 9,500 employees, around 70% (6,700) of which are academics, the University of Vienna is the largest teaching and research institution in Austria.
interests: Education and training, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: We are following all initiatives, policies and legislative files relating to research and education.
